titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to limitations on the amounts of contributions and expenditures that may be made in connection with campaigns for election to public office.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H125)
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.

committee.name: House Judiciary
committee.subcommittee: Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties

bill.summary: 1/5/2011--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Grants Congress the power to set limits on the amounts of contributions and expenditures with respect to candidates in a federal election. Grants a state the power to set limits on the amounts of contributions and expenditures with respect to candidates in a state or local election.
